summary: The IRS relies extensively on IT systems to collect more than $3 trillion in taxes and distribute over $400 billion in refunds annually. In FY 2020, the IRS expects to spend approximately $3.2 billion on IT investments. We testified on several IT problems that could make it harder for the IRS to do its job (e.g., security control deficiencies that could result in unauthorized access...
title: Information Technology: IRS Needs to Address Operational Challenges and Opportunities to Improve Management
